details.title: COVID-19 UPDATES FROM SEPTEMBER 3
details.content:
Kerala can expect a hike in cases in next two weeks, says CM Vijayan. The Kerala CM said the next two weeks are crucial as the state may see Onam clusters being formed due to increased outdoor public activity and travel during the festival time.
(READ ALL UPDATES HERE)

details.title: Conduct COVID-19 tests for children with disability taking Class 10 exams: HC
details.content:
Madras High Court on Thursday directed the School Education Department to conduct Covid-19 tests for the physically and mentally challenged candidates and also their scribes, appearing for Class X private exams, starting September 21.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Delhi Metro to resume: All you need to know
Covishield vaccine reaches Chennai for clinical trials
details.content:
According to officials of the Health Department, the vaccine will be tested on 300 health volunteers above the age of 18 at Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital and Sri Ramachandra Institute of Higher Education and Research, Porur, as part of multi-centric study in India.

details.title: Kerala | 164 more test COVID-19 positive in Ernakulam, 209 recover
details.content:
The district on Thursday reported 164 new Covid-19 cases, of which 149 people got infected through local contact. The total cases include 10 healthcare workers from various hospitals. As many as 209 patients recovered.

details.title: COVID-19 death toll cross 6,000-mark in Karnataka
details.content:
As per the September 2 state war room report, it is taking Karnataka 24 days to double the Covid cases. The positivity rate among asymptomatic cases who have been tested stands at 11.3 per cent and the positivity rate among symptomatic cases is 33.3 per cent.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Rajasthan BJP chief tests positive for coronavirus
details.content:
State president of BJP in Rajasthan, Satish Poonia tests positive for COVID-19. He is asymptomatic and under home-isolation, as advised by doctors.

कल प्रवास से आने के बाद #Covid_19 की जांच करवाई यद्यपि मुझे लक्षण नहीं थे लेकिन मेरी रिपोर्ट +Ve आयी है और डाक्टरी सलाह पर मैंने स्वयं को घर पर ही ISOLATE किया है,
विगत दिनों मेरे से संपर्क में आए सभी व्यक्ति अपना परीक्षण करवा लें,सहयोग के लिए धन्यवाद।@BJP4Rajasthan @BJP4India

— Satish Poonia (@DrSatishPoonia) September 4, 2020

details.title: Hotels, restaurants, clubs in Delhi can serve liquor from September 9-30 on trial basis
details.content:
The excise department in the past gave permission to serve liquor in hotel rooms after Unlock- 4 guidelines were issued last month. As per the direction, bars will be open on a trial basis from September 9 to the month-end, entry will be allowed with face masks and only half of the seating capacity would be permitted inside.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19: Telangana High Court to open physical courts from September 7-11
details.content:

details.title: Over 1.6 lakh cases in last 48-hours take India's COVID-19 tally past 39 lakh-mark
details.content:

details.content:
• Maharashtra minister Sunil Kedar, a Congress leader, has tested positive for COVID-19 and admitted to a private hospital in Mumbai

details.title: DKS back to hospital after developing a fever

details.content:
West Bengal Government allows banks to open for business on Saturdays henceforth. The 2nd and 4th Saturdays which had so long been observed as holidays of banks prior to the earlier notification in the wake of the #COVID19 pandemic, remain so. pic.twitter.com/BbizD5X2Gw

— ANI (@ANI) September 4, 2020

details.title: Doctor, aide arrested for giving forged COVID-19 test reports to people in Delhi
details.content:
Delhi: A doctor and 2 people arrested for issuing 75 forged #COVID19 reports. DCP South says, "It was a nexus. Dr Kush Parashar confessed that he, his associate & helper collected samples, destroyed them without testing & issued forged reports of 4-5 reputed labs to the people." pic.twitter.com/fINcF22pdQ

— ANI (@ANI) September 4, 2020

A 34-year-old doctor and his associate were arrested for allegedly providing forged COVID-19 test reports to people in the national capital, police said on Friday. The accused have been identified as Kush Bihari Parashar, a resident of Malviya Nagar, and his associate Amit Singh, they said. Police said they received a complaint from a reputed testing lab regarding forgery of COVID-19 test reports, following which a case under relevant sections was registered at Hauz Khas police station.

details.title: 'Sero Survey report from Haryana is morale booster'
details.content: State Sero Survey report is morale booster for Corona Yodhas. 8% of the population reported to have developed antibodies. Only .28% tested positive by state labs, it means 7.32% developed antibodies without knowing they are positive: Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij

details.title: Why was Question Hour suspended?
details.content: It was decided to do away temporarily with Question Hour due to extraordinary situation caused by COVID and to avoid assembling of large number officials to be present in galleries of the House during Question Hour in view of the need for social distancing: Lok Sabha Secretariat

details.title: Why was Question Hour suspended?
details.content: It was decided to do away temporarily with Question Hour due to extraordinary situation caused by COVID and to avoid assembling of large number officials to be present in galleries of the House during Question Hour in view of the need for social distancing: Lok Sabha Secretariat

details.title: Why was Question Hour suspended?
details.content:
• It was decided to do away temporarily with Question Hour due to extraordinary situation caused by COVID and to avoid assembling of large number officials to be present in galleries of the House during Question Hour in view of the need for social distancing
  • Holding Question Hour for one or two days is totally different from having it continuously for 18 days. This change is only for the monsoon session and the government has made it clear that the Question Hour will be back in the winter session
  • Everyday, the government will be giving written replies to 160 Unstarred Questions in the upcoming session... this effectively means the government will reply 1,120 questions every week:

details.title: Rajasthan reports 1,570 fresh cases, count rises to 87,797
details.content:
Rajasthan reported 1,570 new coronavirus cases, 679 recoveries and 13 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking total cases to 87,797 including 71,899 recoveries and 1,108 deaths. Number of active cases stands at 14,790: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/Wk9WUR1XgJ

— ANI (@ANI) September 4, 2020

details.title: Himachal records 66 new cases
details.content:
Himachal Pradesh records 66 new #COVID19 positive cases, in the last 24 hours, taking the total positive cases in the state to 6,830 including 1,815 active cases, 4,920 recoveries and 48 deaths: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/PsSfaGSZM0

— ANI (@ANI) September 4, 2020

details.title: Testing on demand for individuals undertaiking travel to countries/states mandating negative COVID test: ICMR
details.content:
Testing on demand for all individuals undertaking travel to countries/Indian states mandating a negative #COVID19 test at point of entry, and for all individuals who wish to get themselves tested; State governments to decide modalities: ICMR advisory pic.twitter.com/ebzNdyjtxf

— ANI (@ANI) September 4, 2020

details.title: Jharkhand reports 1537 new cases
details.content:
Jharkhand's #COVID19 case tally rises to 48,039 with 1,537 cases reported today. The numbers of active and recovered cases are 15,549 and 32,043 respectively; the death toll is at 447: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/EaWdqob1JD

— ANI (@ANI) September 4, 2020

details.title: IN PICS | Scenes from shopping malls in Coimbatore
details.content:
Facemasks, social distancing stickers and sanitisers: Welcome to the new normal as shopping malls open up after five months as a part of #Unlock4 in Tamil Nadu.
Visuals from Coimbatore

Express Photos | @rk_clicks @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/UBAWjGXtjb

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) September 4, 2020
